meanings.definition: One who spurs or urges on
meanings.sent1: The spurrer encouraged the team to keep going during the race.
meanings.sent2: The coach was a great spurrer, always motivating the players to do their best.
meanings.sent3: The spurrer's cheers echoed through the stadium, pushing the athletes to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a spurrer, propelling her friends towards success.
meanings.sent5: The spurrer's presence was like a gentle push, guiding everyone towards their goals.

meanings.sent1: The promise of a reward can be a powerful spurrer for hard work.
meanings.sent2: A challenging goal can serve as a great spurrer for personal growth.
meanings.sent3: The thought of ice cream after dinner was a delightful spurrer for finishing homework quickly.
meanings.sent4: The upcoming deadline acted as a spurrer, pushing him to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent5: The image of success was a bright spurrer, driving her towards her dreams.
